de.tum.ws2010.propra.raytracer.lights
Class DirectLight

java.lang.Object
  de.tum.ws2010.propra.raytracer.lights.Light
      de.tum.ws2010.propra.raytracer.lights.DirectLight
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectionalLight, PointLight
public abstract class DirectLight
extends Light

Represents all kinds direct light sources, i.e. light sources that have a light direction to each position in space. Accordingly, these light sources can be shadowed by objects in the scenery.

Author:
(c) 2009-11 Roland Fraedrich (fraedrich@tum.de)

Method Detail

getLightDirection

public abstract Vector3d getLightDirection(Vector3d pos)
Returns the direction from the light source to a certain position. Has to be implemented for all derived light sources.

Parameters:
pos - Postion for which the light direction has to be computed.
Returns:
Light direction, from the light source to the given position.

getShadowRay

public Ray getShadowRay(Vector3d pos)
Returns the shadow ray from a certain position to the light source.

Parameters:
pos - Position for which the shadow ray has to be created.
Returns:
Shadow Ray from the given position to the light source.

isShadowed

public abstract boolean isShadowed(Vector3d position,
                                   Scenery scenery)
Tests if a point is shadowed by an object of the scenery Has to be implemented for all derived light sources.

Parameters:
position - Position for which the shadow test is performed.
scenery - Scenery which might occlude the light source.
Returns:
True, if the light source is shadowed by the scenery, false if not.

illuminate

public java.awt.Color illuminate(Intersection i,
                                 Scenery s)
Description copied from class: Light
Illuminates an intersection point by the light source.

Specified by:
illuminate in class Light
Parameters:
i - Intersection point to illuminate.
s - Scenery to test if the light source is shadowed.
Returns:
Color as the result of illumination. Black, if light source is shadowed.
